intro: Fernandoa ferdinandi, commonly known as the Ferdinand's fern, is a species of flowering plant native to the island of Fernando de Noronha in Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat. Fernandoa ferdinandi is relatively rare and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and limited distribution.
